episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of fascinating topics, including a robot that can jump over the Statue of Liberty if both were on the moon, the last speaker of the Bo language who spoke to birds, The Rolling Stones' tour being sponsored by a retirement planning organization, and how clowns can identify amateurs by their makeup application.

facts.fact: Scientists have invented a 30 centimeter tall robot that could jump over the Statue of Liberty if it was on the moon.
The last ever speaker of the Bo language of the Andaman Islands would only speak it to birds who she considered to be her ancestors.
The Rolling Stones' latest tour was sponsored by a retirement planning organisation.
Clowns can spot amateur clowns by the amount of makeup that they put around their mouths.
